EBIT measures the profit a company generates from its operations, making it synonymous with operating profit.. By ignoring tax and interest expenses, it focuses solely on a company's ability to generate earnings from operations, ignoring variables such as the tax burden and capital structure. This focus makes EBIT an especially useful metric for certain applications. DEFINITION of 'Earnings Before Interest & Tax-EBIT'. An indicator of a company's profitability, calculated as revenue minus expenses, excluding tax and interest. EBIT is also referred to as operating earnings, operating profit and profit before interest and taxes (PBIT).
